snippet: New York Times employees, including Executive Editor Jill Abramson, share how being hit by vehicles made a lasting impact on them.
abstract: New York Times Executive Editor Jill Abramson describes how being hit and badly injured by delivery truck while walking in New York City in 2007 forever changed the way she experiences the city; presents stories of three other Times employees who were hit by vehicles and survived; comments on Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's reduction of traffic fatalities by 30 percent during his tenure, spate of awful accidents in 2014, and Mayor Bill de Blasio's goal of further reducing deadly accidents.

byline.contributor: Denise Fuhs, Andrew Kueneman and Mick Sussman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: New York Times employees, including Executive Editor Jill Abramson, share how being hit by vehicles made a lasting impact on them.

headline.seo: How Being Hit by a Vehicle Changed Times Colleagues’ Lives
headline.main: Struck on the Street: Four Survivors
